meanings.sent1: The thrilling roller coaster ride titillated my senses.
meanings.sent2: The romantic movie titillated the audience with its passionate scenes.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was meant to titillate, but it ended up being a disaster.
meanings.sent4: The idea of traveling to exotic lands titillated her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies titillated my taste buds.

meanings.definition: To tease or provoke in a playful way
meanings.sent1: The mischievous child loved to titillate his little sister with funny faces.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes never failed to titillate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy would titillate the cat by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her witty remarks never failed to titillate a smile from him.
meanings.sent5: The gentle tickle of the feather titillated her skin.
